values.description:
Some fixes needed to at least compile the library. Mainly coming from:

 * M_PI needs the define _USE_MATH_DEFINES
 * Replace all [std::]fabs by std::abs which also overloads the int type.
 * Replace all math.h by the c++ cmath
 * std::isfinite only takes floating pointt types as argument. Implicit cast for int works in GCC but VC wants the user to define which is the target type.
 * getpid is a bit different in windows, needs a different header and use the _getpid function.

Quite fun ... Now I only have 192 Warnings and 61 Error to be able to compile the test suite. Not bad.
values.title: Portability fixes from visual c++ 2013

summary.raw:
Some fixes needed to at least compile the library. Mainly coming from:

 * M_PI needs the define _USE_MATH_DEFINES
 * Replace all [std::]fabs by std::abs which also overloads the int type.
 * Replace all math.h by the c++ cmath
 * std::isfinite only takes floating pointt types as argument. Implicit cast for int works in GCC but VC wants the user to define which is the target type.
 * getpid is a bit different in windows, needs a different header and use the _getpid function.

Quite fun ... Now I only have 192 Warnings and 61 Error to be able to compile the test suite. Not bad.
summary.html:
Some fixes needed to at least compile the library. Mainly coming from:

  • M_PI needs the define _USE_MATH_DEFINES
  • Replace all [std::]fabs by std::abs which also overloads the int type.
  • Replace all math.h by the c++ cmath
  • std::isfinite only takes floating pointt types as argument. Implicit cast for int works in GCC but VC wants the user to define which is the target type.
  • getpid is a bit different in windows, needs a different header and use the _getpid function.

Quite fun ... Now I only have 192 Warnings and 61 Error to be able to compile the test suite. Not bad.

values.description: Some fixes for the compilation (not the linking) in the test suite.
values.title: Fix test compilation in VC++

summary.raw: Some fixes for the compilation (not the linking) in the test suite.
summary.html: Some fixes for the compilation (not the linking) in the test suite.

values.description:
After fighting some hours with the DLL model in MSCV, I've finally built the whole library and tests. Some notes:

 * VC++ is extremely verbose with -Wall , specially when used with gtest. It is recommended to use W4 warning level.
 * It is critical to keep the ```BUILDING_DLL``` ifdef and flag ([see how to use it](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_math/pull-request/new#Lcmake/Utils.cmakeT55) with ```set_source_files_properties```) in the Helpers.hh and **only** use it for compiling the source files belonging to the library. Do **not** use the flag for compiling the tests or any other software the uses the library. Keep this in mind if you see problems with missing symbols which refers to static data members.

Now I can built the library and the tests, but the test suite is still not able to run completely. Run the first test (via CTest) and windows open a new terminal and run the google test part corresponding to the first test. The new terminal disappear but the main one does not continue with the rest of the test suite. More fun ahead, yes.

Addendum: 13 warnings still left to fix, but hey, there were 40k yesterday.
values.title: Fix whole compilation on VC++

summary.raw:
After fighting some hours with the DLL model in MSCV, I've finally built the whole library and tests. Some notes:

 * VC++ is extremely verbose with -Wall , specially when used with gtest. It is recommended to use W4 warning level.
 * It is critical to keep the ```BUILDING_DLL``` ifdef and flag ([see how to use it](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_math/pull-request/new#Lcmake/Utils.cmakeT55) with ```set_source_files_properties```) in the Helpers.hh and **only** use it for compiling the source files belonging to the library. Do **not** use the flag for compiling the tests or any other software the uses the library. Keep this in mind if you see problems with missing symbols which refers to static data members.

Now I can built the library and the tests, but the test suite is still not able to run completely. Run the first test (via CTest) and windows open a new terminal and run the google test part corresponding to the first test. The new terminal disappear but the main one does not continue with the rest of the test suite. More fun ahead, yes.

Addendum: 13 warnings still left to fix, but hey, there were 40k yesterday.
summary.html:
After fighting some hours with the DLL model in MSCV, I've finally built the whole library and tests. Some notes:

  • VC++ is extremely verbose with -Wall , specially when used with gtest. It is recommended to use W4 warning level.
  • It is critical to keep the BUILDING_DLL ifdef and flag (see how to use it with set_source_files_properties) in the Helpers.hh and only use it for compiling the source files belonging to the library. Do not use the flag for compiling the tests or any other software the uses the library. Keep this in mind if you see problems with missing symbols which refers to static data members.

Now I can built the library and the tests, but the test suite is still not able to run completely. Run the first test (via CTest) and windows open a new terminal and run the google test part corresponding to the first test. The new terminal disappear but the main one does not continue with the rest of the test suite. More fun ahead, yes.

Addendum: 13 warnings still left to fix, but hey, there were 40k yesterday.

values.description:
This pull request fix the SSE detection on the ARM architecture. SSE is only present on x86.

I'm importing a cmake module which is able to get the system architecture by compiling a piece of c code, there is no native cmake command or module for this, AFAIK.

While fixing this, I've found that the SSE4 detection code seems broken to me, nothing is setting the ENABLE_SSE4 variable. We probably need to fix Gazebo too.

I've also create an ARM -any- job in jenkins which runs on docker + qemu.
[The testing run](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_math-any-devel-trusty-armhf/5) corresponding to this pull request.
values.title: Fix SSE detection on ARM (and SSE4 on x86)

summary.raw:
This pull request fix the SSE detection on the ARM architecture. SSE is only present on x86.

I'm importing a cmake module which is able to get the system architecture by compiling a piece of c code, there is no native cmake command or module for this, AFAIK.

While fixing this, I've found that the SSE4 detection code seems broken to me, nothing is setting the ENABLE_SSE4 variable. We probably need to fix Gazebo too.

I've also create an ARM -any- job in jenkins which runs on docker + qemu.
[The testing run](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_math-any-devel-trusty-armhf/5) corresponding to this pull request.
summary.html:
This pull request fix the SSE detection on the ARM architecture. SSE is only present on x86.

I'm importing a cmake module which is able to get the system architecture by compiling a piece of c code, there is no native cmake command or module for this, AFAIK.

While fixing this, I've found that the SSE4 detection code seems broken to me, nothing is setting the ENABLE_SSE4 variable. We probably need to fix Gazebo too.

I've also create an ARM -any- job in jenkins which runs on docker + qemu. The testing run corresponding to this pull request.

values.description:
A nice counterpart to computing the mean of a signal is computing its variance. This pull request adds `SignalVariance` which uses an incremental ("online") algorithm, that is [credited to Knuth and others](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithms_for_calculating_variance#Online_algorithm). I added some basic tests, as well as a test using normally distributed random values with expectations on the [expected sample variance](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Variance#Distribution_of_the_sample_variance) that I borrowed from [Noise_TEST.cc in gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/82df42e8f4b5861bfb79bc718261e5b19ce89a7f/gazebo/sensors/Noise_TEST.cc#cl-150).

* [drone.io is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/105)
* [homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-math/job/ignition_math-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/11/)
* [windows is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-math/job/ignition_math-any-devel-windows7-amd64/4/console), though it didn't run the tests (@\_jrivero_)
values.title: Add SignalVariance to SignalStats

summary.raw:
A nice counterpart to computing the mean of a signal is computing its variance. This pull request adds `SignalVariance` which uses an incremental ("online") algorithm, that is [credited to Knuth and others](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithms_for_calculating_variance#Online_algorithm). I added some basic tests, as well as a test using normally distributed random values with expectations on the [expected sample variance](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Variance#Distribution_of_the_sample_variance) that I borrowed from [Noise_TEST.cc in gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/82df42e8f4b5861bfb79bc718261e5b19ce89a7f/gazebo/sensors/Noise_TEST.cc#cl-150).

* [drone.io is happy](https://drone.io/bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/105)
* [homebrew is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-math/job/ignition_math-any-devel-homebrew-amd64/11/)
* [windows is happy](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-math/job/ignition_math-any-devel-windows7-amd64/4/console), though it didn't run the tests (@\_jrivero_)
summary.html:
A nice counterpart to computing the mean of a signal is computing its variance. This pull request adds SignalVariance which uses an incremental ("online") algorithm, that is credited to Knuth and others. I added some basic tests, as well as a test using normally distributed random values with expectations on the expected sample variance that I borrowed from Noise_TEST.cc in gazebo.

  • drone.io is happy
  • homebrew is happy
  • windows is happy, though it didn't run the tests (@_jrivero_)

values.description:
I see some warnings when building ign-math on windows 8 with Visual Studio 2012. This fixes them.
~~~
[ 38%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/ignition-math2.dir/Kmeans.cc.obj
Kmeans.cc
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(117) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(123) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(130) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(144) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(162) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
~~~

They [don't show up in Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-math/job/ignition_math-any-devel-windows7-amd64/7/) though. Maybe because it's using Windows 7?

I know we're in freeze mode, but I'm going to forget about little things like this unless I make the pull request.
values.title: Fix windows 8 warnings

summary.raw:
I see some warnings when building ign-math on windows 8 with Visual Studio 2012. This fixes them.
~~~
[ 38%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/ignition-math2.dir/Kmeans.cc.obj
Kmeans.cc
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(117) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(123) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(130) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(144) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(162) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
~~~

They [don't show up in Jenkins](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign-math/job/ignition_math-any-devel-windows7-amd64/7/) though. Maybe because it's using Windows 7?

I know we're in freeze mode, but I'm going to forget about little things like this unless I make the pull request.
summary.html:
I see some warnings when building ign-math on windows 8 with Visual Studio 2012. This fixes them.

[ 38%] Building CXX object src/CMakeFiles/ignition-math2.dir/Kmeans.cc.obj
Kmeans.cc
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(117) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(123) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(130) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(144) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch
C:\Users\scpeters\ws\gazebo\ign-math\src\Kmeans.cc(162) : warning C4018: '<' : signed/unsigned mismatch

They don't show up in Jenkins though. Maybe because it's using Windows 7?

I know we're in freeze mode, but I'm going to forget about little things like this unless I make the pull request.

values.description:
fixed library prefix/suffix for find_library in config.cmake for windows
libraries need to be .dll with no lib prefix in windows. Confirmed this works when I call find_package(gazebo) from another project.
values.title: fixed config.cmake for windows

summary.raw:
fixed library prefix/suffix for find_library in config.cmake for windows
libraries need to be .dll with no lib prefix in windows. Confirmed this works when I call find_package(gazebo) from another project.
